Other medical problems that contribute to high blood levels of uric acid include     -  high blood pressure    -  hypothyroidism (underactive thyroid gland)    - conditions that cause an excessively rapid turnover of cells, such as psoriasis, hemolytic anemia, or some cancers    - Kelley-Seegmiller syndrome or Lesch-Nyhan syndrome, two rare conditions in which the enzyme that helps control uric acid levels eithe
